name: NeuralMemory
description: Brain-inspired persistent memory for AI agents — neurons, synapses, and fibers. REQUIRED: set plugins.slots.memory = "neuralmemory" in openclaw.json to disable the default memory-core plugin and activate NeuralMemory as the exclusive memory provider.

pythonPath.description: Path to Python executable with neural-memory installed

brain.description: Brain name to use for this workspace

autoContext.description: Inject relevant memory context before each agent run

autoCapture.description: Auto-extract and store memories after each agent run

_setup.label: Required Setup
_setup.help: Add to openclaw.json: { "plugins": { "slots": { "memory": "neuralmemory" } } } — this disables the default memory-core plugin so agents use NeuralMemory exclusively. Without this, agents may still call memory_search (memory-core) even with AGENTS.MD rules.

pythonPath.label: Python Path
pythonPath.help: Path to Python executable that has neural-memory installed (pip install neural-memory)

brain.label: Brain Name
brain.help: Which brain to use — each workspace can have its own brain

autoContext.label: Auto-inject Context
autoContext.help: Automatically query relevant memories and inject them before each agent run

autoCapture.label: Auto-capture Memories
autoCapture.help: Automatically extract facts, decisions, and insights after each agent run

contextDepth.label: Context Depth
contextDepth.help: How deep to search: 0=instant lookup, 1=contextual, 2=habit patterns, 3=full graph traversal

maxContextTokens.label: Max Context Tokens
maxContextTokens.help: Maximum tokens to inject as context (higher = more context but uses more prompt space)

timeout.label: MCP Timeout (ms)
timeout.help: How long to wait for MCP server responses. Increase if you see timeout errors on slow machines (default: 30000)
